info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 01 at 8:36PM EDT until June 01 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM EDT FOR NORTHERN RICHLAND AND NORTHEASTERN CRAWFORD COUNTIES... At 836 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Plymouth, or 17 miles northwest of Mansfield, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Mansfield, Shelby, Plymouth, Tiro, Shenandoah and Olivesburg. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
